rComments: Really caring prof who knows his stuff! He is a good lecturer. The material can be a challenge but go to his office hours. I had Gracie Tran as my TA and she was really helpful. The class will make you think differently about crime but that's a good thing. Lectures go all 3 hours
atrocious organization of lecture notes, terrible marking, dull teaching

If I could only have one crim prof it would be Watson. Hes so kind and supportive. His lectures are interesting and his assessments are all straight forward. Go to class and his office hours and you have no excuse to not do well. Hes so easy to talk to and so helpful if you need help with the course. He truly wants his students to succeed.

Hes an absolutely amazing professor. His lectures are amazing. His office hours are always helpful. I've never had a prof who goes above and beyond to help his students like this. His lectures are interesting and I truly believe he enjoys seeing and helping students succeed. If you go to class and office hours there is no excuse to not do well

I've taken 3 classes with Professor Watson. CRI365, CRI385, and CRI386. He is my favourite professor. Hands down. He is an amazing lecturer even though he does not use slides. I would take his class any day. His assignments are always marked fairly and he is always available to talk to and ask questions. He has the best crim classes.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Respected', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Great professor, who always has something interesting to share.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy']

rComments: He's great!

Best professor at U of T! Not only was the content of the course very interesting, but his lectures, although dense, are very easy to follow thanks to his charisma. Very helpful and very caring. The material is very hard but he i very clear in the explanation.

One of the nicest and most helpful prof. His office hours are very helpful as he patiently answer all questions in details, and always have extended office hours. He cares and respects your original thoughts and gives very inspirational feedback and insights. Really enjoyed discussing with him. Not from Crim but wish to take more classes with him.

Definitely my favourite prof in the whole  Crim department (the rest just blurb around about political correctness). For 385, pay close attention to the first 2-3 weeks. They are key to rest of the course. Fair marker, extremely flexible with office hours, and funny in a witty, very British way. Get ready to think outside the box.
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Clear grading criteria', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Very open-ended test questions, just takes some time to get used to how he wants you to see things for the course.

Professor Watson is my favourite prof at UofT without a doubt. I have taken two of his classes so far and plan on taking two more with him this year.  Average course load. He is a fair marker, a great lecturer and you will learn a lot. I would definitely recommend taking any of his classes but you do need to attend lectures.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Gives good feedback', 'Caring']

rComments: Watson is a great lecturer, but you have to attentively listen and take notes! He often moves around from topic to topic so paying attention is key to do well! The topics are quite interesting.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read', 'So many papers']

rComments: Lectures are long & dry and half (probably 3/4) the time you have no clue what's going on. Also, he likes to spend 30-45 mins every class recapping the previous week. However everything eventually comes together & its not an extremely difficult or time consuming course.
He loves Clueless and Starship Troopers. Don't worry you'll pass.  VERY HELPFUL BUT VERY HARD CLASS.
This man is a God.

Took all of Watson's classes throughout university! He knows his stuff and knows how to present! The only thing is that he doesn't use slides, so you have to go to class. But it's a lot of fun! Highly reccommend.
Very clear and interesting lectures. Very approachable and helpful.

One of the best, best professors on this planet earth. Professor Watson is a world class prof whose brilliant wit, humor, and passion for his course shine through along with how much he genuinely cares about his students.  He is a very fair marker, a great lecturer, and what every prof should be like. UofT's favourite by far!!!

Prof. Watson was epic. He really delved into complex topics in an easy to understand manner. It was tough in the sense that he has a pretty strong british accent and does not use power point so we had to scribble down notes ferociously for the 3 hours, but he was awesome nonetheless. He gives practice questions for the test which help A LOT!!!
One of the smartest profs in the university. Recommended
What a great guy! Great lectures, extremely clear and organized, and well-designed class. I'm not a Criminology person and he made it so interesting for me. Would definitely recommend!

He's a good prof, very wry in his humour, nice and willing to help his students. Lectures could be hard to keep up with at times, although he usually ended early. The course was too theoretical in my opinion, but it had some interesting parts to it. Didn't like my TA, though - brutal marker. Difficult to get an A unless you try very hard.
He is an amazing professor. Very approachable. Attending lectures is not an option: there are no power points, and the readings do not align completely with what is being taught.

The lectures are So boring and the textbook isn't even required to write the essay. So long as you have a good thesis then the paper is fine. He can be intimidating because he is so smart, esp. during office hours. But, you will write someof the best essays in his class!

Best Professor, no contest. No powerpoints, and good luck on reading his writing, but you learn so much from him. He always has stories to help explain. Out of class, he always finds time for you. I took every class I could of his. I did not want to miss out. Definitely recommend!

I took all the course WW taught and he is great. I like his test format and how he gives you the questions ahead of time. As long as you attend class, do the readings and write out an outline for the essay test you'll be fine. The grading in this class is very fair. He is very helpful with helping you select an essay topic and takes you through it.

You'll feel like you've learned NOTHING when you step out of every lecture because of complete and utter confusion. But the reality is, you'll learn SO MUCH from him by the end of the term. The knowledge hits you.

Makes sure the grading is fair, unlike most other U of T profs. Takes the pressure off with questions in advance. Completely incomprehnsible when he gets started on Durkheim and Foucault, but it's important. All in all a really good class!
boring

I took every course prof. Watson taught.  You need to get used to his style and his T.A.s suck but he seriously cares about helping you better yourself intellectually and he's got the greatest, driest, British humour ever.

Best prof ever! really cares about his students and their intellectual progress. Take his course and it will make you a better overall academic. Taking his courses actually made me feel like that I was in a place of higher education.

law and psychiatry - take this course if you want to get a 73%.  on all tests, everyone gets that mark, and close to that mark on the final paper.  t.a. caroline greene always gives feedback on everyone's paper saying there is no thesis (even though we all wrote theses in our papers).  very difficult to do above a 73 and material is DRY.

took all of his classes. takes a while to get used to teaching style but ive never met a professor who cares as much about his students as this one. genuinely wants you to learn and get a good mark.  readings are long but you dont need to do all of them. great teacher, great courses
Prof. Watson is sweet, kind and extremely helpful...which is rare in today's impersonal urban universities.  Luv him!

Fantastic Prof! I've never known any Prof who goes so far out of their way to help students. He is always available, he selects great TAs, and once you get past his hot English accent, his material is provocative and useful. Tests are also very fair.

I respect Watson for his attempts to take anxiety out of being a student. Gives exam questions in advance, don't have to study much. Fair marker. Always available to help on essays. Don't have to attend many classes. However, lectures are LONG and boring and sometimes complex. His are still the easiest courses though.
very knowledgeable. material is repetitive at times. marking evaluation is fair. don't need to study much for tests because you get to focus on one topic only.
doesn't care about students, doesn't explain things and thinks he's god
Really, really cares about his students.  Always very friendly and helpful.  Lectures well organized but no powerpoints, just straight lecturing.
No Comments
No Comments
Competent, clear, helpful, positive, available.

Lectures requires one to stay focused throughout in order to really absorb the material. Essays are graded fairly, with lots of feedback. Course structure make this class one of best- 4 one hour tests and one essay-this is the best structure available.
No Comments
Great accent, makes it worth while sitting though the 3 hour lectures! Great prof
can be boring at times, but is a very good, very smart prof. He needs to type notes though
very boring and repetitive. Lectures could reasonably be cut down to 1.5 hours.
Very intelligent. Material always organized. Extremely fair with marking.
Lectures were so boring and sometimes went for 3 hours.
